name: Steenberg Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whoever is running this hotel knows what they are doing. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left it was outsandingly good. We had a wonderful tastefully furnished room with a view over the golf course to the mountains. Both bedroom (and ensuite) and the sitting room were spacious and comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellence personified

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had breakfast lunch and dinner at the hotel and all were excellent with attentive service and great food.
reviews.title: We absolutely loved it & will certainly be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were friendly and helpful throughout our visit and we are looking forward to returning.
reviews.title: Lovely and luxurious!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: One small negative - why no SuperSports3 on the TV so we can watch Premier league football?
reviews.title: A Wonderful Hotel and Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife & I recently spent 3 wonderful nights at Steenberg Hotel. We have been fortunate to have stayed in many 5 star hotels, but this one was one of the best. The scenery was magnificent, the room was large & comfortable with a very large bathroom. The verandah over looking the mountains added to the peace & serenity of Steenberg. The restaurant was excellent & we enjoyed our meals there. The spa staff were professional & very good. We most certainly would return there. The location was excellent, far enough to be quiet & peaceful, but near enough to visit Hout Bay & The Water Front in Cape town.
reviews.title: Fabulous and we'll be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: The hotel was charming, the grounds were enchanting, the restaurant was one of the best I've ever had the pleasure to enjoy,,,,,,,,I only wish we could have stayed longer (forever perhaps!). I look forward to coming back to edit/update this review once i have my photos sorted and ready for posting. In the meantime, if you are wondering whether or not to book at Steenberg -- wonder no further: THIS IS your place to stay in Cape Town.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed here for four days to recover from flights, one from New England the other from California, on the way to Botswana. It was everything we needed in terms of cleanliness, service, relaxation. The restaurant was outstanding. The complimentary bottles of wine were of high quality and I only wish we had time to golf on the very beautiful course associated with the hotel. There were a couple of very minor issues. The room where we stayed was closer to the laundry facilities than we would have wished and then there was the issue of the TV. Another reviewer noted the dated TVs. I opened the cabinet, agreed that it was not very modern, closed the cabinet and never opened it again. We didn't endure our long flights to watch TV. But boy did we eat!
reviews.title: Exactly what we needed it, when we needed it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family hobby is travel, so we do a lot of it. Steenberg overachieved typical expectations at multiple levels
reviews.title: Set a new standard for a vacation experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was central, 15min to the main city/waterfront, easy access to southern routes (Hout Bay etc), 10 min to St. James Beach, and 30 min from where the main wine routes start. And right in the heart of our favourite wine making area, Constantia. Steenberg is also one of the best loved brands in wine making itself, so actually staying on a winery/golf course was what made the experience so unique for us.
reviews.title: the perfect end to the perfect wedding day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In many top hotels, service can be exacting but impersonal – run like a well oiled machine. What set our experience of Steenberg apart was that the service was very personable, and yet blew past our expectations in actual delivery.
reviews.title: Ticked All The Boxes!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed here for three days as a precursor to a week in central Cape Town. I have stayed in a similar standard of hotels in SA before so I was not surprised - and certainly not disappointed - by the standards encountered, of welcome, service, food (breakfast and evening dining) and accommodation.
reviews.title: Top quality service, food and drink in a friendly relaxed atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is some way (20 km) from the airport and a taxi costs ZAR 400.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing seems too much trouble (not that I had any unusual requests)
reviews.title: Great but lacking??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and the atmoshere was very relaxing, punctuated only by the alarm call of geese in the morning. Free newspapers and free Internet were most welcome although TV was limited, perhaps due to the local conditions: only BBC World and Discovery Channel. Otherwise it was a mixture of SA channels, some of which broadcast only in Xhosa and Afrikaans, of course.
reviews.title: Serene atmosphere at the Steenberg Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The presentation in the restaurant was of the highest quality (a dish oif lamb, lamb and more lamb from the Karoo stays long in the memory) while the selection of wines from Constantia and other regions included sufficient choice of wines by the glass to complement the menus.
reviews.title: Surely the best in Cape Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: On our way back to Cape Town we spent a night in the beautiful Steenberg Hotel. We had 2 premium rooms that we found extremely comfy, clean, spacious and with a direct access on a small piece of private garden and the golf. Having a walk around we fell under the spell of this old farm.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel in a beautiful vineyard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Not to mention that the wine was very good as well!
reviews.title: Impecable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sadly some of us arrived at the Steenberg hotel quite ill, with a bad virus caught in the plane and we'd like to thank the staff warmly as a doctor was called very quickly and our medicines were collected by the staff from the closest chemist around. Everything was done to help us and it was a real relief.
reviews.title: Tasteful luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As a consequence we cancelled our booking at Catarina's restaurant. Which is a pity as the restaurant is known as one of the best around.
reviews.title: breathtaking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Others from our group had the chance to get a massage from the spa which they really enjoyed.
reviews.title: Excellence and luxury around every corner

description: This luxury hotel surrounded by vineyards nestles at the foot of the magnificent Stone Mountain. Here the elegance & tradition of the 17th century blend harmoniously with the luxuries and conveniences of our modern age. A Championship golf course, an award winning Winery, Catharina’s Restaurant and Steenberg Spa complete the serene picture of this 24-bedroom Hotel.
